title: North America contributes to over 70% of the Global Enterprise Social Software (ESS) business
text:
The report titled Enterprise Social Software Market - North America Outlook (2015-19) showcases an in-depth analysis of the North American market in terms of market size and the respective market forces (drivers, constraints, opportunities and challenges). This report also forecasts the growth numbers till 2019 (on a YoY basis) and hence suggests the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) for the estimated period.
Though a mere majority in terms of market capitalization, North America still finds difficulty in penetration in its own terms
Enterprise Social Software or ESS as commonly termed as, has found a close connect with that of enterprise collaboration software. This exhibits numerous benefits as in breaking down organizational barriers, fostering cross-functional connections, reducing latency and better internal co-ordination; however has not been effective enough in several cases. The ESS market in North America has observed several roadblocks both at management and operational level. Challenges include: resistance to change, inadequate sponsorship, high expectations, poor internal co-ordination on knowledge sharing and non-alignment of IT infrastructure.
USA remains the un-doubted leader globally as well as within this region. Given the maturity of the customers higher sales number are expected from the region, though the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) may not be the best in comparison with other regions. Similarly, on the supply end the best ESS providers are based (or headquartered) out of USA, each trying to extract the best from the market.
Market Segments and Forecasts Covered in the Report
The North America Enterprise Social Software market is segmented
· Deployment (On-Premise, Cloud)
· End users (Enterprise, Mid-size, Small Business)
· Industry (Financial Services, E-commerce, IT and Telecommunication, Healthcare, Retail, Others)
Companies discussed in the Global Enterprise Social Software market research report are IBM, Microsoft, Jive, Salesforce, Zimbra, Mzinga, SAP, Opentext Corp, Socialtext, eXo Platform, EMC, Oracle, Google, Interact Intranet, Alfresco, Infor, Elcom Technology, Autodesk, Sitrion, Spigit (Mindjet).
